Chocolate Butter

The next time a mid-morning sugar craving hits, try giving plain butter a sweet, indulgent upgrade. This velvety, easy-to-make spread requires cocoa powder and a few minutes of your time.

Charlyne Mattox

Rate








Print










Share


















































 

Bored by your usual breakfast routine? The next time a mid-morning sugar craving hits, try giving plain butter a sweet, indulgent upgrade. This velvety, easy-to-make spread requires just three ingredients and a few minutes of your time. It's delicious served at room temperature, slathered on warm toast or flaky croissants. Get the recipe.
Photo: Charles Masters






Hands On Time:
5 mins


Total Time:
5 mins


Yield:
1 ½ cup














Ingredients



½ cup unsalted butter, room temperature


½ cup semisweet chocolate chips, melted


1 tablespoon cocoa powder


  salt





Directions




Beat butter, melted chocolate chips, cocoa powder, and a pinch salt with an electric mixer until smooth, about 1 minute.





Serve at room temperature spread on toast or croissants.
